channel.title: Simple compile error
channel.description:
Short and sweet error:
Player.java:570: illegal start of expression public void updatePlayerMovement(stream str) { ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . . --------------------------------------------------------- Thank you for your time. ~V1n

item.title: Simple compile error
item.dc:creator: @o0_v_1_n_o0 o0 v 1 n o0
item.description:
@o0_v_1_n_o0 wrote:

I edited what I had with yours and…

// handles anything related to character position basically walking, running and standing
// applies to only to “non-thisPlayer” characters}
public void updatePlayerMovement(stream str) {
if(dir1 == -1) {
// don’t have to update the character position, because the char is just standing
if(updateRequired || chatTextUpdateRequired) {
// tell client there’s an update block appended at the end
str.writeBits(1, 1);
str.writeBits(2, 0);
}

Thank you for your time.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 14, 2007, 07:02:13 PM[/size][hr]Anyone?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 14, 2007, 07:29:31 PM[/size][hr]If no ideas of fixing by means of editing, is there another way I could just re-place it all-together?

Read full topic

item.title: Simple compile error
item.dc:creator: @o0_v_1_n_o0 o0 v 1 n o0
item.description:
@o0_v_1_n_o0 wrote:

How about I just post what I have here:

// handles anything related to character position basically walking, running and standing
// applies to only to “non-thisPlayer” characters}
public void updatePlayerMovement(stream str) {
if(dir1 == -1) {
// don’t have to update the character position, because the char is just standing
if(updateRequired || chatTextUpdateRequired) {
// tell client there’s an update block appended at the end
str.writeBits(1, 1);
str.writeBits(2, 0);
}

Thanks for your time.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple compile error
item.dc:creator: @Evan1 Evan`
item.description:
@Evan1 wrote:

You need stream str.And you missed a closing bracket (}) above it.
